org.rootsdev.polygenea.nodes

Class Connection

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.rootsdev.polygenea.Node
      • org.rootsdev.polygenea.nodes.Claim
        • org.rootsdev.polygenea.nodes.Connection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Node>

    public class Connection
extends Claim
    A Connection embodies directed relationships between two other claims. Any possessive like “object's relation is subject” and most prepositional phrases like “subject is the relation of object” suggest Connections. When drawn as an arrow, it is most natural to say “object —relation→ subject”, as in “Eve —child→ Able” or “York —inside→ England”.

    Some sources provide undirected and many-party connections, such as "A, B, and C were brothers". That kind of claim is handled by Grouping nodes.

    Some Connection nodes can be reduced to Property nodes. See the discussion under Property for more.

    At some point a set of standardised relation fields will be produced. Even once they are, though, custom relations will be permitted.

    Author:
    Luther Tychonievich. Released into the public domain. I would consider it a courtesy if you cite my contributions to any code derived from this code or project that uses this code.

    • Method Detail

      • validate

        public boolean validate(java.lang.StringBuilder log)
        Description copied from class: Node
        Performs any validation that the node might need. The Node class just checks the UUID. Subclasses should override this method to perform any additional validation they might need, such as verifying that fields are not null.
        Overrides:
        validate in class Claim
        Parameters:
        log - A place where descriptions of problems will be written. If the node is valid, log is not used.
        Returns:
        true if the node is valid, false otherwise.
